definitions: Travel some distance regularly between one's home and place of work or study.
Reduce (a judicial sentence, especially a death sentence) to one less severe.
Exchange (a payment or series of payments) for another, especially a single lump sum.
Change the nature, form, or relationship of.
examples: I commute to work by train every day.
His death sentence was commuted to life imprisonment.
They decided to commute their pension into a lump sum.
The order of operations can be commuted.
